contents.item: Always be like a water. Float in the times of pain or dance like waves along the wind which touches its surface.

contents.item: It is not the possession of truth, but the success which attends the seeking after it, that enriches the seeker and brings happiness to him.

contents.item: It isn't what you have, or who you are, or where you are, or what you are doing that makes you happy or unhappy. It is what you think about.
I don’t know what’s worse: to not know what you are and be happy, or to become what you’ve always wanted to be, and feel alone.

contents.item: My advice to you is get married: if you find a good wife you'll be happy; if not, you'll become a philosopher.

contents.item: I surround myself with things that make me happy. Why? Because ... it makes me happy.
